UniProt Entry.description: The amino acid sequence of the current peptide coincides with the part of the UniProt entry that may represent a peptide precursor.

Literature.Title: The saposin-like protein SPP-12 is an antimicrobial polypeptide in the pharyngeal neurons of Caenorhabditis elegans and participates in defence against a natural bacterial pathogen.
Literature.Author: Hoeckendorf A, Stanisak M, Leippe M

Sequence Information.Target Organism: Escherichia coli OP50(MIC=>10µM),Escherichia coli OP50(MBC=>10µM),Bacillus megaterium ATCC 14581(MIC=0.275µM),Bacillus megaterium ATCC 14581(MBC=0.275µM),Bacillus thuringiensis B-18247(MIC=>10µM),Bacillus thuringiensis B-18247(MBC=>10µM),Saccharomyces cerevisiae S150(LC=0.5µM),Dictyostelium discoideum Ax3-ORF(LC=>1µM),Jurkat cancer cells(no activity data)
